annotations.caption: Located in the middle of the image is the Jockey Club Innovation Tower, or for classes building Z. It is a combination of glass and steel and has a curved, wave-like design. The building is 15 stories tall and has a total of 23 floors. The exterior of the building is made up of a series of undulating shapes and curves, with the building’s main entrance located on the podium floor. The building’s design is intended to represent the flowing motion of water, which is appropriate for a building that houses a school of engineering. The building’s facade is made up of large expanses of glass, which allow natural light to flood the interior of the building and provide views of the surrounding city. The building is topped with a series of balconies and rooftop terraces, which provide additional space for outdoor gathering and relaxation. Overall, the building’s exterior is a stunning example of contemporary architecture and is a landmark in the city of Hong Kong. The interior of the building is also very modern and well-equipped, with many laboratories and research facilities. This building is located in the Hong Kong Polytechnic University
